result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

miscConds.notes:

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation.

No contact with the Home Depot on West National Ave. in West Allis, WI
Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing hearing proceeded. Statements by State, Defense Counsel, Defendant, and AR.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Court ordered Defendant to serve 89 DAYS in the House of Correction with credit for 59 DAYS time served. Huber privileges to apply for work and treatment.

Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for NINE MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION

Contact the Probation and Parole Office by 5:00pm on TODAY -- AUGUST 5TH, 2022.  

No use or possession of alcohol. 

No possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Complete an AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.

Complete 30 hours of community service.

No contact with the Home Depot on West National Ave. in West Allis, WI

Pay ALL MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Court waived all NON-MANDATORY costs, fees, and surcharges.

Restitution set at ZERO.

Defendant is to provide a DNA sample by 3:00pm on AUGUST 8TH, 2022 and pay the DNA surcharge.

Any cash bond on deposit to be applied. 

APPELLATE RIGHTS GIVEN

Defendant Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.  State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
Court is in receipt of the; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum and WIS JI- Criminal/Elements of the Offense.

AS TO COUNT 1 

PLEA HEARING HELD:  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  
Defendant advised that if he is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. 
Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. State consents to the Jury Waiver. Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 
Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge. 

Sentencing to proceed.
Pretrial Supervision Report, received and filed
Case rescheduled off the record due to judge unavailability.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Case in court for pretrial conference. Defense counsel has received discovery and no offer from the state.  Defense requests status date to determine case posture. Case adjourned to Branch 30. Status Conference is scheduled for June 24, 2022 at 8:30am.
Pre-trial conference on May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Home Depot, 11071 W. National Ave., West Allis
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.

Defendant Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Andrew Stephen Wojak-Hanson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
